intro: Conyza graminifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf horseweed, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and pastures. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small white to pale yellow flowers. Conyza graminifolia is often considered a weed but has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
